metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9514 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to a reset flood, potentially leading to a denial of service. The attacker opens a number of streams and sends an invalid request over each stream that should solicit a stream of RST_STREAM frames from the peer. Depending on how the peer queues the RST_STREAM frames, this can consume excess memory, CPU, or both. It was discovered that Netty incorrectly implements HTTP/2. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9514` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

h2o - 2.2.5+dfsg2-3
libh2o-evloop0.13 - 2.2.5+dfsg2-3
libh2o0.13 - 2.2.5+dfsg2-3
No subscription required

libnode64 - 10.19.0~dfsg-3ubuntu1
nodejs - 10.19.0~dfsg-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

trafficserver - 8.0.5+ds-1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 8.0.5+ds-1
No subscription required

python-twisted - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
python-twisted-bin - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
python-twisted-core - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
python-twisted-mail - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
python-twisted-names - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
python-twisted-news - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
python-twisted-runner - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
python-twisted-web - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
python-twisted-words - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
python3-twisted - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
python3-twisted-bin - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
No subscription required

python-twisted-conch - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> nginx added http2 support in 1.9.5 nginx previously fixed issue for CVE-2018-16844 netty added http2 support in 4.1.0 twisted added http2 support in 16.3 trafficserver enabled http2 support by default in 7.0 mdeslaur> Packages built using golang need to be rebuilt once the vulnerability has been fixed. This CVE entry does not list packages that need rebuilding outside of the main repository or the Ubuntu variants with PPA overlays. sahnaseredini> nodejs patch is a version upgrade

criterions.comment: golang-google-grpc package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
grpc package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
h2o package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.5+dfsg2-3').
netty package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
nodejs package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.19.0~dfsg-3ubuntu1').
trafficserver package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.5+ds-1').
twisted package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '18.9.0-6ubuntu1').
twisted package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '18.9.0-6ubuntu1').
